title: How to Make Carrot Tortillas

steps.headline: Mix flour, salt, and baking powder together.
Add oil and mix until you can ball the flour up.
steps.description: It should be like playdough but it will crumble very easily.

steps.headline: Heat carrot puree just until warm.
Add carrot puree to the flour mixture until it doesn't stick to the side of the mixing bowl anymore.
steps.description: Add more small amounts of flour and/ or warm water if needed to get to that consistency. You want your dough to be sticky enough to be able to handle it but not sticky enough that when you start to roll it out you need flour.

steps.headline: Let the masa sit in a bowl covered with a towel for about 15 minutes
Separate masa into 2 inch (5.1 cm) balls (bigger or smaller depending on how big you want the tortillas).
Roll the masa out until it is ⁄8 inch (0.3 cm) thick.
Cook the tortilla on one side until it starts to bubble.
steps.description: Then flip it and cook on the other side until done.

steps.headline: Place your tortillas on a covered plate or in a tortilla warmer.

text: Mix flour, salt, and baking powder together.  Add oil and mix until you can ball the flour up. It should be like playdough but it will crumble very easily. Heat carrot puree just until warm.  Add carrot puree to the flour mixture until it doesn't stick to the side of the mixing bowl anymore. Add more small amounts of flour and/ or warm water if needed to get to that consistency. You want your dough to be sticky enough to be able to handle it but not sticky enough that when you start to roll it out you need flour. Let the masa sit in a bowl covered with a towel for about 15 minutes  Separate masa into 2 inch (5.1 cm) balls (bigger or smaller depending on how big you want the tortillas).  Roll the masa out until it is ⁄8 inch (0.3 cm) thick.  Cook the tortilla on one side until it starts to bubble. Then flip it and cook on the other side until done. Place your tortillas on a covered plate or in a tortilla warmer.
